results.deck: An arcade game developed by Konami in 1981. It was later ported to the Atari 2600 by Parker Brothers.
results.name: Amidar

results.deck: Released for the Sega Master System in 1991, Asterix is a 2D platformer.
results.name: Astérix

results.deck: Blast a never-ending onslaught of meteors, missiles, and UFOs out of the sky as a laser battery commander.
results.name: Astrosmash

results.deck: Abzû is an underwater exploration game from Giant Squid.
results.name: Abzû

results.deck: European exclusive platformer starring the indomitable Gaul, Astérix. It was released on all three Nintendo platforms of 1993: NES, Game Boy and SNES. US releases were planned but canceled.
results.name: Astérix

results.deck: A vertically-scrolling XBLIG non-shooter scheduled to release for $1.00 in August 2011.
results.name: Andromium

results.deck: A space-based, first-person puzzle game revolving around an astronaut trying to repair a heavily damaged space station orbiting the Earth.
results.name: Adr1ft

results.deck: AirMech is a real-time strategy game that puts players in the world as a robot that can turn into a jet.
results.name: AirMech

results.deck: The first game in the popular Angelique series. It is generally acknowledged to have marked the beginning of the otome genre.
results.name: Angelique

results.deck: A vertical scrolling shoot'em up for the Commodore 64 developed by David Cooper. First published in 1986 by Alpha-Omega Software and re-released in 1988 by The Power House.
results.name: Aftermath

results.deck: An action game from Acclaim based on the 1992 David Fincher movie. The player assumes the role of Ripley as she explores the prison planet of Fury 161.
results.name: Alien³

results.deck: A top-down driving game that was released in 1985 as an adaptation of the 1980 role-playing game Car Wars.
results.name: Autoduel

results.deck: AeternoBlade is a side scrolling action adventure with a time-reversal mechanic. Known as Time Avenger in Japan.
results.name: AeternoBlade

results.deck: Auditorium is a puzzle game where you manipulate particle rays with physics to create a colorful audiovisual landscape.
results.name: Auditorium

results.deck: Apache Longbow is an helicopter combat simulator by Digital Integration, putting you in the cockpit of the AH-64D attack helicopter.
results.name: Apache

results.deck: The player controls the tongue of a aardvark called Aardy through maze-like ant colonies eating ants and their larvae in this action game based on the coin-op Anteater.
results.name: Aardvark

results.deck: ATAC (Advanced Tactical Air Command) is a flight and strategy simulation that puts the player in the shoes of a secret anti-drug task force in Columbia whose mission is to disrupt and destroy the local drug networks.
results.name: ATAC

results.deck: A Japanese role-playing game originally released for the Super Famicom in 1993. It follows a trilogy of Aretha RPGs for the Game Boy with a new main character and story.
results.name: Aretha

results.deck: An isometric water-themed shooter  set in a Imperial Victorian setting from Games Distillery.
results.name: Aqua

results.deck: Business simulation game from Koei released for the SNES and Genesis. Known in Japan as "Air Management: Oozora ni Kakeru", which was also released for the Sharp X68000.
results.name: Aerobiz

results.deck: DS adventure game developer Cing's most recent release is about an FBI agent who can see the past. He uses this to his advantage in the "Providence" murder cases.
results.name: Again

results.deck: Aerowings on the Dreamcast is a Flight Simulator in which you play as a stunt pilot in the Japanese version of the Blue Angels.
results.name: AeroWings

results.deck: The player has to find the Golden Idol which is hidden within a ancient Aztec temple in this 2D action-adventure platformer.
results.name: Aztec

results.deck: A new helicopter flight sim developed by Gaijin Entertainment and published by Activision.
results.name: Apache: Air Assault

results.deck: Another physics-based puzzle by Rovio, this one is more centered on Rube-Goldberg machines and is based on the game Casey's Contraptions, which they purchased the rights to.
results.name: Amazing Alex

results.deck: Aion: Tower of Eternity is an MMORPG by NCSoft with a unique PvPvE system using the first CryEngine. Originally released in Korea, it was relaunched for China, Japan, Taiwan, North America and Europe in 2009.
results.name: Aion: Ascension

results.deck: Capcom's fourth iteration in the Ace Attorney series places rookie Apollo Justice in the hot seat as the latest defense attorney looking to make a name for himself.  Using an updated game engine, help Apollo prove his defense skills while solving the mysteries of the past.
results.name: Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney

results.deck: America's Army 3.0 is the latest version of the America's Army franchise and has stepped the game into the next level with the utilization of the Unreal Engine 3 and the addition of new maps, weapons and achievement system.
results.name: America's Army 3

results.deck: Army Men: Air Attack 2 is the sequel to Amy Men: Air Attack, developed by 3DO, featuring two new helicopters and a new co-pilot.
results.name: Army Men: Air Attack 2

results.deck: The fourth iteration of the U.S. Army's free first-person shooter.
results.name: America's Army: Proving Grounds

results.deck: Art Academy: Home Studio (Art Academy Atelier in Europe) is the latest fully-featured Art Academy title and the first entry on home consoles. It is an eShop-only title in North America while being offered as a retail game in Europe.
results.name: Art Academy: Home Studio

results.deck: A compilation of Atari 2600 games.
results.name: Activision's Atari 2600 Action Pack

results.deck: A DSiWare launch title
results.name: Art Style: AQUIA

results.deck: The eleventh installment of the Atelier series and first of the Arland trilogy. Rorona has taken up the task to keep the alchemist workshop from closing by completing assignments issued by the Arland Kingdom.
results.name: Atelier Rorona: Alchemist of Arland

results.deck: A action maze-game based on the coin-op Anteater in which the player controls the tongue of Ardy the aardvark through an underground maze trying to eat drops of food and to evade worms, stinging ants and spiders.
results.name: Ardy the Aardvark

results.deck: Based on the animated film of the same name, Arthur and the Invisibles is an adventure game featuring various puzzles and obstacles.
results.name: Arthur and the Invisibles

results.deck: Operation Arrowhead is the first stand-alone expansion pack to Bohemia Interactive's war simulator, ARMA II. Set soon after the events of ARMA 2.
results.name: ArmA II: Operation Arrowhead

results.deck: Assassin's Creed: Altaïr's Chronicles is a prequel to the original Assassin's Creed for the DS and mobile devices.
results.name: Assassin's Creed: Altaïr's Chronicles

results.deck: Dejobaan's semi-sequel to AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! A Reckless Disregard for Gravity.
results.name: AaaaaAAaaaAAAaaAAAAaAAAAA!!! for the Awesome

results.deck: Freak the hell out about water in this downloadable release from Eko Software.
results.name: Aqua Panic!

results.deck: Accele Brid is a behind-the-back shooter starring three large robots, released only in Japan for the SNES in 1993.
results.name: Accele Brid

results.deck: You play as Roman from the rebel group, the Lionhearts, trying to take down the evil King Forge.
results.name: Armed and Dangerous

results.deck: Take on some Mensa-approved questions in this downloadable trivia/puzzle game from Square-Enix.
results.name: American Mensa Academy

results.deck: The renowned sandbox series comes to Nintendo's Game Boy Advance. Transplanting many of the series' new gameplay mechanics to the older top-down 2D perspective, GTA Advance aims to bring the open-world freedom of GTA to the palm of your hand.
results.name: Grand Theft Auto Advance

results.deck: Based on a cartoon on Nickelodeon, Avatar: The Last Airbender is an action game that puts you in the role of Aang, a young and powerful airbender. Console Version was developed by THQ Studio Australia.
results.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender

results.deck: Ace Combat returns to the PSP, this time with a real world setting and online cooperative play.
results.name: Ace Combat: Joint Assault

results.deck: The second title in the Cho Aniki series.
results.name: Ai Cho Aniki

results.deck: Armor Battle is an Intellivision game for two players, and features two-on-two tank battles across hundreds of battlefields.
results.name: Armor Battle

results.deck: The sequel to Audiosurf, formerly known as Audiosurf Air.
results.name: Audiosurf 2

results.deck: Tribes: Aerial Assault is an online FPS released in 2002. It had a pretty big cult following for several years, but recently it's become a rarity to see anyone playing it online at all.
results.name: Tribes: Aerial Assault

results.deck: A cooperation between KnapNok Games and Nifflas, Affordable Space Adventures is a stealth-puzzle game for Wii U that makes extensive use of the Wii U GamePad's touch screen to control the Uexplore spacecraft. Includes co-op for up to three players.
results.name: Affordable Space Adventures

results.deck: AeroWings 2: Air Strike is a simulation of  flying a jet that focuses on training missions.
results.name: AeroWings 2: Air Strike

results.deck: A  vertical action arcade shooter that combined the action of an F14 Fighter Jet and a helicopter gunship pitted against hordes of alien invaders intent on dominating the Earth.
results.name: A-Jax

results.deck: Age of Conan is a massively multiplayer online role playing game set in the Conan lore.
results.name: Age of Conan: Hyborian Adventures

results.deck: Japanese-developed visual novel / point-and-click adventure game, released in 1991. The title and imagery is inspired by Alice in Wonderland. Designed and directed by Haruhiko Shono, it pioneered the use of pre-rendered 3D graphics in adventure games, two years before Myst.
results.name: Alice: An Interactive Museum

results.deck: Fourth game in the AeroWings / Aero Dancing series.
results.name: Aero Elite: Combat Academy

results.deck: ArmA II: Ultimate Military Simulator is, as the title would suggest, a Military Simulation game developed by Bohemia Interactive. Experience the intensity of lifelike combat situations in one of the most realistic soldier sims available.
results.name: ArmA II

results.deck: The second DS iteration in GUST's long-running Atelier series. It is notable for being the first of what are considered the main Atelier series to be released in North America.
results.name: Atelier Annie: Alchemists of Sera Island

results.deck: A match-three game starring Ice Age characters.
results.name: Ice Age Avalanche

results.deck: The third game in the popular Angelique series of otome dating sims.
results.name: Angelique Trois

results.deck: A vertical space shooter game originally on Arcade machines then moved to the NES
results.name: Alpha Mission

results.deck: Beyond Atlantis, also known internationally as Atlantis II, is a PC and Mac adventure game.
results.name: Beyond Atlantis

results.deck: APB Reloaded is a persistent online shooter created by Real Time Worlds, developer of Crackdown, in which players are able to choose between enforcers and criminals as they duke it out in the streets of San Paro.
results.name: APB Reloaded

results.deck: Assassin's Creed is a stealth action-adventure game developed by Ubisoft Montreal. In the year 2012, Desmond Miles is kidnapped and made to relive his ancestor's memory through a machine called the Animus. As the ancestor, Altaïr, players unveil an assassin conspiracy set in the middle ages.
results.name: Assassin's Creed

results.deck: A mystery story about family, desperation and the weather, set to the beat of an indie adventure game.
results.name: Richard & Alice
Android Assault: The Revenge of Bari-Arm

results.deck: Aquatopia is a downloadable virtual aquarium for use with the PlayStation Eye.  It is listed on the PlayStation Store as "Interactive Art".
results.name: Aquatopia

results.deck: Achron is the first game to feature single-player and multiplayer free-form time travel. It is the world's first meta-time strategy game, a real-time strategy game where players and units can jump to and play at different times simultaneously and independently.
results.name: Achron

results.deck: Asterix for the Atari 2600 was the first video game that starred the popular French cartoon character.
results.name: Asterix

results.deck: Race at dizzying speeds while taking out your opponents and watching for obstacles.
results.name: Ammotrack

results.deck: You play as a US Navy Seal and it's your job is to break into Alcatraz prison to free some hostages that are being held by terrorists.  Take out those nasty terrorists with a wide range of weaponry including machine guns, flame-throwers and bombs.
results.name: Alcatraz
